curam.util.client.domain.util
Class DomainUtils

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.client.domain.util.DomainUtils

public final class DomainUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Utility methods for access to domain information and management of the correct parsing, validating, and formatting sequences for field values based on a domain. This is the main point of access to the domain converter functionality for most client infrastructure code. The locale and time zone information is not needed: they are provided via thread-local variables.

Method Detail

getDomainNodeSet

public static org.apache.xpath.NodeSet getDomainNodeSet(java.lang.String name)
Gets a NodeSet containing basic domain information. If an error occurs, it is not reported, so this may mask a configuration problem. This method is for use by XSLT stylesheets that need to access domain information.

Parameters:
name - The name of the domain for which information is required.
Returns:
The NodeSet or null if there is no information available or an error occurred.

getCodeTableDomainName

public static java.lang.String getCodeTableDomainName(java.lang.String codeTableName)
                                               throws JDEException
Gets the a domain name corresponding to a code-table name. This is not the domain in the UML model with which the code-table was associated. The domain is created dynamically as a descendant of the "CODETABLE_CODE" domain and given a generated name. This is useful for situations where no domain was modeled for the given code-table (such as when a code-table is created at run-time through the administration interface), or where the domain name is unknown.

Parameters:
codeTableName - The name of the code-table.
Returns:
The name of a domain associated with that code-table.
Throws:
JDEException - If the domain name cannot be retrieved.

parseAndValidate

public static java.lang.Object parseAndValidate(java.lang.String data,
                                                java.lang.String domainName,
                                                boolean mandatory)
                                         throws JDEException
Parses and validates a value and performs the mandatory field value check. This performs the same operations as the DomainUtils.parseAndValidate(String, ClientDomain, boolean) method, but it accepts a domain name string rather than a domain object for convenience.

Parameters:
data - The string to be parsed and validated.
domainName - The name of the data's domain.
mandatory - The mandatory value indicator.
Returns:
The parsed and validated object value.
Throws:
JDEException - If the parsing or validation fails.

parseAndValidate

public static java.lang.Object parseAndValidate(java.lang.String data,
                                                ClientDomain domain,
                                                boolean mandatory)
                                         throws JDEException
Parses and validates a value and performs the mandatory field value check. The mandatory check is performed after pre-validation (where performed). Field labels should be added later (if possible) to any exception thrown from this method.

Parameters:
data - The string to be parsed and validated.
domain - The domain information.
mandatory - The mandatory value indicator.
Returns:
The parsed and validated object value.
Throws:
JDEException - If the parsing or validation fails.

parseAndValidateGeneric

public static java.lang.Object parseAndValidateGeneric(java.lang.String data,
                                                       java.lang.String domainName)
                                                throws JDEException
Parses and validates a generic string representation of a value. This performs the same operations as the DomainUtils.parseAndValidateGeneric(String, ClientDomain) method, but it accepts a domain name string rather than a domain object for convenience.

Parameters:
data - The string to be parsed and validated.
domainName - The name of the data's domain.
Returns:
The parsed and validated object value.
Throws:
JDEException - If the parsing or validation fails.

parseAndValidateGeneric

public static java.lang.Object parseAndValidateGeneric(java.lang.String data,
                                                       ClientDomain domain)
                                                throws JDEException
Parses and validates a generic string representation of a value. The mandatory check is not performed, as it has no meaning in this context. Similarly, the "custom validation function" is not invoked, as it is not relevant to generic parsing. Field labels should be added later (if possible) to any exception thrown from this method.

Parameters:
data - The string to be parsed and validated.
domain - The domain information.
Returns:
The parsed and validated object value.
Throws:
JDEException - If the parsing or validation fails.

format

public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Object data,
                                      java.lang.String domainName)
                               throws JDEException
Formats the data object to its string representation. This performs the same operations as the DomainUtils.format(Object, ClientDomain) method, but it accepts a domain name string rather than a domain object for convenience.

Parameters:
data - The object to be formatted.
domainName - The name of the data's domain.
Returns:
The formatted string representation of the object.
Throws:
JDEException - If the formatting fails.

format

public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Object data,
                                      ClientDomain domain)
                               throws JDEException
Formats the data object to its string representation. Field labels are not available during formatting, so they will not be applied later to the exceptions.

Parameters:
data - The object to be formatted.
domain - The domain information.
Returns:
The formatted string representation of the object.
Throws:
JDEException - If the formatting fails.

formatGeneric

public static java.lang.String formatGeneric(java.lang.Object data,
                                             java.lang.String domainName)
                                      throws JDEException
Formats the data object to its generic string representation. This performs the same operations as the DomainUtils.formatGeneric(Object, ClientDomain) method, but it accepts a domain name string rather than a domain object for convenience.

Parameters:
data - The object to be formatted, must not be null.
domainName - The name of the data's domain.
Returns:
The formatted string representation of the object.
Throws:
JDEException - If the formatting fails.

formatGeneric

public static java.lang.String formatGeneric(java.lang.Object data,
                                             ClientDomain domain)
                                      throws JDEException
Formats the data object to its generic string representation. The "custom validation function" is not called, as it is not relevant to generic formatting. This method is usually used when returning embedded string representations of data back to the application server, such as when returning XML documents.

Parameters:
data - The object to be formatted, must not be null.
domain - The domain information.
Returns:
The formatted string representation of the object.
Throws:
JDEException - If the formatting fails.
